name: Systems, Systems Quiz | Video Games Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars" is a very detailed game for its system.  Which system am I referring to?
questions.explanation:
Super Nintendo.

	"Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars" is a single player RPG which should appeal to many Nintendo fans.  In this installment of the Mario series, Mario once again has to save Mushroom Kingdom, but this time, Bowser isn't the problem.  This game was released on March 8, 1996 in North America.

questions.text: There are many different "Resident Evil" games, but only one system was released with "Resident Evil Zero".  Which system was it?
questions.explanation:
Gamecube.

	In "Resident Evil Zero", Rebecca Chambers retells her story of what happened before the Spencer Mansion in "Resident Evil".  This prequel to of the "Resident Evil" series was introduced to North America on November 11, 2002.

questions.text: "The Legend of Zelda: The Minish Cap" was released in early 2005.  What handheld system was it released on?
questions.explanation:
Game Boy Advance.

	This installation in the "Zelda" series follows Link as he once again needs to save Princess Zelda and Hyrule, but this time, he has the help of the Minish.  Although the Nintendo DS was released a very short time before this game, Nintendo continued to produce both Game Boy games as well as DS games.

questions.text: What system was the first "Metroid" game released on?
questions.explanation:
NES.

	The "Metroid" series stars Samus Aran as she goes through the galaxy.  Many games in the series were created for the Nintendo, Super Nintendo, Game Boy Advance, Nintendo DS and Gamecube systems.

questions.text: What system is "WarioWare: Touched!" played on?
questions.explanation:
Nintendo DS.

	The Nintendo DS is a handheld system with two screens.  The top screen is a normal screen, but the bottom can be used as a touch pad.  Wario has been in many games on many different systems.  He started his own "Wario" series on the original Nintendo system with the "Wario's Woods" game.

questions.text: Is "Super Smash Bros." played on the Nintendo 64?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	The sequel to "Super Smash Bros." is "Super Smash Bros. Melee".  The difference is that one is played on the Nintendo 64, and the other is for the Gamecube.

questions.text: What system was "Earthbound" first played on?
questions.explanation:
Super Nintendo.

	"Earthbound" is the sequel to the Nintendo game, "Mother".  "Earthbound" is a lengthy game with a good plot and lots of fun things to do, but the graphics were mediocre compared to other games released at the time such as "Donkey Kong Country" and "The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past".

questions.text: "Animal Crossing" is played on the Gamecube.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In "Animal Crossing", you'll be able to live in a quiet town, do different tasks, and have fun with locals.  This game came with its own memory card because of the game's size.  This game became one of Gamecube's "Player's Choice" games.

questions.text: Which James Bond video game was not created for a Nintendo system?
questions.explanation:
Tomorrow Never Dies.

	"Goldeneye" was one of the recipients of the Nintendo Game of the Year Award.  "Everything or Nothing" was released on the Gamecube system in 2004 and its plot is not adapted from a previous James Bond movie.

questions.text: Which "Mario" game was not released on a handheld system?
questions.explanation:
Super Mario Sunshine.

	"Dr. Mario" was originally released on the Game Boy, while "Mario Pinball Land" and "Mario vs. Donkey Kong" were for the Game Boy Advance.  The odd one out, "Super Mario Sunshine" was made for use on the Gamecube system.
